passage_text: Bloating is one of the common symptoms of pregnancy that many women experience. It is a condition of excess gas in the body that makes you feel uncomfortable . You may experience frequent bloating in early pregnancy, but as you get closer towards the end of pregnancy, you may feel less bloated.

Experts say that average person passes gas around 15 times daily and it is still considered normal to do so 40 times in one day. To answer the question, yes bloating is an early sign of pregnancy. Sometimes it can be hard to distinguish early pregnancy bloating and pre-period bloating, but most women do in fact feel bloated early on during their pregnancy.

query_text: description of how early pregnancy bloating feels
passage_text: While others can't yet detect your pregnancy, by 5 weeks pregnant you may start feeling pregnant. If you have given birth previously you might notice your abdomen looks slightly larger than usual. This is largely the result of bloating. The uterus doesn't rise out of the pelvis until roughly 14 weeks pregnant but many women start experiencing bloating during early pregnancy. You may find your belly looks more poofy at the end of the day than early in the morning. Some women mistake this early pregnancy sign as a premenstrual sign.

passage_text: Many women experience bloating, mild cramping and slight backache as a pre-menstrual physical symptom, and the same thing happens in early pregnancy as the uterus grows. Many women worry when they feel mild cramping, tugging and pulling in the early weeks after conception.
